name: New Worlds: Music of Golijov

location.name: Mazzoleni Concert Hall, Royal Conservatory of Music

description:
Associate Dean of The Glenn Gould School and Director of The Taylor Academy, Barry Shiffman leads a concert of works by celebrated Argentine-American composer Osvaldo Golijov

Among other works, the program includes Tintype, a new work co-commissioned by the Royal Conservatory of Music for viola and string quintet.

name: Cinema Kabuki 2026 Toronto
description:
In high definition on the big screen, direct from Japan, with English subtitles. 

Enjoy a twisted comedy set in the tenements in Rakuda: Party with a Dead Man, the further developments of the scandalous secret love and downfall in Princess Sakurahime Part II and a romantic yet domestic dance-comedy in The Zen Substitute.

name: Winter Weather Nature Walk in High Park
description:
Have you ever wondered why winters get so cold, why snowflakes have such intricate patterns, or how pond animals survive once the water freezes? 

Bundle up and join us for a family-friendly nature walk to explore the fascinating science behind the chilliest season of the year! We'll learn about the causes of winter weather, the secretive subnivean layer, and how plants and animals adapt to the cold Canadian winter.

name: Nature Through a Lens: A Deep Dive Into High Park's Wildlife
description:
You are invited to the third annual wildlife photography presentation of High Park!

Through the lenses of local photographers, revisit familiar wild animals and meet new neighbours, with each image offering a glimpse into their lives, habits, and challenges. We will also learn about how our actions shape their future in the urban ecosystems of High Park and Toronto.
